Title: Sales assistant
AlternativeTitle: Shop assistant, sales person, store assistant, retail assistant, retail sales assistant
Overview: Sales assistants sell products and help customers.

EntryRouteSummary: You can get into this job through:a college course; an apprenticeship; working towards this role; volunteering; applying directly

RelevantSubjects: You can learn some of the skills you need for this job by doing a:Level 2 Certificate or Diploma in Retail Skills; Level 3 Diploma in Retail Skills Sales Professional
EntryRequirements: 2 or more GCSEs at grades 9 to 3 (A* to D), or equivalent, for a level 2 course
4 or 5 GCSEs at grades 9 to 4 (A* to C), or equivalent, for a level 3 course

RelevantSubjects: You could get into this job through a retailer intermediate apprenticeship.
EntryRequirements: some GCSEs, usually including English and maths, or equivalent, for an intermediate apprenticeship

Work: You could apply for permanent jobs after getting some experience from:a temporary job in a store at Christmas; a weekend job
Volunteering: Getting experience volunteering in a charity shop could lead into paid work.
DirectApplication: You can apply directly for jobs. Employers may ask for some GCSEs at grades 9 to 4 (A* to C), including English and maths. Retail or customer service experience will also be helpful.

CareerTips: It will help if you:are confident about selling; have a positive, helpful attitude; can get on well with a wide range of customers
Some stores, like mobile phone or DIY shops, may expect you to have good knowledge of their products before you apply.

WhatItTakes.DigitalSkillsLevel: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

Skills.Description: the ability to work well with others
patience and the ability to remain calm in stressful situations
to be thorough and pay attention to detail
the ability to use your initiative
the ability to sell products and services
the ability to think clearly using logic and reasoning
the ability to understand peopleâ€™s reactions
knowledge of computer operating systems, hardware and software

RelatedRestrictions: be over 18 to sell alcohol and other restricted goods

WYDDayToDayTasks: In this role you could be:serving and advising customers; arranging goods in displays and on shelves; rotating and replacing stock; promoting extra products; taking cash and card payments and making sure the till balances; dealing with returns; meeting sales targets

WorkingEnvironment.Location: You could work at a store, in a stock room, at a garden centre or at a garage.
WorkingEnvironment.Environment: Your working environment may be physically demanding and crowded.
WorkingEnvironment.Uniform: You may need to wear a uniform.

CareerPathAndProgression: With experience you could become a retail manager or departmental manager.
You could specialise in customer services or buying merchandise.
You could also set up and run your own independent shop or stall.
